pagetitle: A collection of catalogs, manuals and reports published during the project
title: Results and Publications

pw0-1.title: Project desription
pw0-1.name: Project 40322: SAMSKAB - FROM GRAY HOUSING ASSOCIATIONS TO GREEN NEIGHBORHOOD COMMUNITIES (in danish)
pw0-1.summary: The project challenges the notion that the green transition takes place primarily through individual behavior and technological change by pointing out that it can take place just as much as a fundamental social change involving neighboring communities. The project contributes knowledge and tools that can support the establishment of completely new green neighborhood communities as well as the transition from gray housing associations to green neighborhood communities and thereby strengthen the green transition. Gray housing associations are referred to here as housing associations that do not have a direct focus on the environment, climate and sustainability, while green neighboring communities are defined as green, where their members share the desire to live more sustainably and act together on this desire.

wp1-r1.title: Catalog of Ideas
wp1-r1.description: Best-practice idea catalog, which gathers experiences from 10 established and well-functioning green neighboring communities, housing associations and eco-communities, in collaboration with Bofaellerskap.dk which runs a knowledge bank on the subject.

wp1-r2.title: Training Course
wp1-r2.description: Creates competencies and knowledge in green enthusiasts, so that they are equipped to start the building of green neighboring communities. This is done in collaboration with DeltagerDanmark and their Green Academy.

wp1-r3.title: Mentoring
wp1-r3.description: Mentoring course where enthusiasts from existing green neighborhood communities are connected to a new neighborhood community to inspire, help and support the establishment.

wp1-r4.title: Behavioral Challenges
wp1-r4.description: Behavioral challenges about concrete resident-driven activities that motivate residents to green changes in everyday life.

wp2-r1.title: Evaluation
wp2-r1.description: Evaluation that documents how the above tools work in practice with recommendations for improvements and optimization thereof.

wp2-r2.title: Interviews
wp2-r2.description: Min. 20+ semi-structured interviews of key players.

wp2-r3.title: Focus Groups
wp2-r3.description: Min. 3 focus groups with community or board members.

wp2-r4.title: Analysis
wp2-r4.description: Analysis of relevant internal documents, strategies, articles of association and reports.

wp2-r5.title: Course
wp2-r5.description: To assist municipal staff in the development of their action plans to strengthen community and sustainability.

wp2-r6.title: Course
wp2-r6.description: To build competencies among both employees in housing associations as well as board members / representatives in housing associations (both share, owner and tenant).

wp2-r7.title: Catalog of Ideas
wp2-r7.description: Gathers experiences from 10 established and functioning green neighborhood communities. Targeted at employees in municipalities and housing associations.

wp3-r1.title: Semi-structured Interviews
wp3-r1.description: 30 + semi-structured interviews of key actors and participants.

wp3-r2.title: Focus Group Discussions
wp3-r2.description: 3+ focus group discussions with selected groups of members

wp3-r3.title: CO² calculator
wp3-r3.description: Development of CO² calculator for neighboring communities and housing actors.

wp3-r4.title: Questionnaire
wp3-r4.description: Questionnaire about CO² imprints with randomized sample of 1000+ Danes.

wp3-r5.title: Survey
wp3-r5.description: Survey of CO² imprints among participants in green neighboring communities.

wp3-r6.title: Analysis Report
wp3-r6.description: Analysis report on the environmental and social impact of green neighboring communities

wp4-r1.title: Tools
wp4-r1.description: eg training courses, are offered through partners to relevant employees.

wp4-r2.title: Following of development
wp4-r2.description: Follow developments in about 100 green neighborhoods.

wp4-r3.title: Survey
wp4-r3.description: Institutional survey on the organization of green neighborhoods.

wp4-r4.title: Interviews
wp4-r4.description: 20 + interviews with key players in selected new green neighborhoods.

wp4-r5.title: Report
wp4-r5.description: Report on upscaling of green neighboring communities at national level and recommendations

wp5-r1.title: Project meetings
wp5-r1.description: 10 project meetings per year, where core partners exchange research results.

wp5-r2.title: Solution Labs
wp5-r2.description: 8 solution labs, where the researchers' results are presented to collaborators and other stakeholders. All collaborators are involved in all solution labs.

wp5-r3.title: Academic Articles
wp5-r3.description: Publishing min. 6 academic articles in international journals

wp5-r5.title: International seminar
wp5-r5.description: Holding of 1 international seminar on the collective part of environmental behavior.

wp5-r7.title: Ongoing dissemination
wp5-r7.description: Publication and ongoing dissemination of idea catalogs, guidance manuals, training courses, courses, webinars and reports produced in WP 1-4.

wp5-r8.title: Website
wp5-r8.description: Website with all catalogs, manuals and reports published in the project.

wp5-r9.title: Op-Eds
wp5-r9.description: Min. 4 Op-Eds in daily news papers.

wp5-r10.title: Podcast Series
wp5-r10.description: Podcast series 'from Gray to Green' (4 episodes).

wp5-r11.title: Articles
wp5-r11.description: Articles in stakeholder media channels (member letters, newsletters, etc.).

wp5-r12.title: Meetings
wp5-r12.description: Meetings of the Advisory Panel (minimum two meetings per year).
